About half grow all or some of their vegetables either in their own garden or in a nearby allotment. Some provide their own eggs and poultry. {INFORMATION SYSTEM }Chulmleigh is lucky in enjoying one of the first Community Libraries; shared by the Library Service and Secondary School. {LOCAL HISTORY }The first mention of a village at Chulmleigh is in the Domesday Book of 1086 where Chalmon- leuga (Chalmon's clearing in the woods (?)) is recorded as being owned by Baldwin and comprising 40 ploughlands and 30 villeins.
